column1: The venom of tarantulas found in the United States is not considered dangerous, but it may cause allergic reactions.

If you are allergic to tarantula venom, these symptoms may occur: - Breathing difficulty - Loss of blood flow to major organs (an extreme reaction) - Eyelid puffiness - Itchiness - Low blood pressure - Rapid heart rate - Skin rash - Swelling at the site of the bite - Swelling of the lips and throat

The person may receive: - Blood and urine tests - Breathing support, including oxygen - Chest x-ray - EKG (electrocardiogram, or heart tracing) - Intravenous fluids (through a vein) - Medicines to treat symptoms
